content: Is someone using the Forum module? I have a client who needs a forum site, and I'm wondering if it's working fine and how flexible the module is. Disclaimer: I don't know the module at all, never used it on D7.

I'm wondering if it's working fine

Well we're using it on https://forum.backdropcms.org/ so I'd say it's working fine :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

BWPanda said:

I'm wondering if it's working fine

Well we're using it on https://forum.backdropcms.org/ so I'd say it's working fine :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

We're not, actually. We use a combo of Views and custom code borg_forum there.
Ha, interesting! Well there you go. Looks like we removed it from core... Makes sense I guess, based on how broken/weird I remember it being in D7. I thought we must have fixed it. Shame.
Yeah, I wish that we improved/fixed the contrib forum module instead of "hacking" our own "special" version for forum.b.org ...that way the larger community would benefit from that.
Maybe we should release our version as an alternative solution...

Thanks for your feedback so far! I was aware the Backdrop Forum wasn't built with the contrib module, and I'm curious if the custom module would be a realistic alternative. @docwilmot you seem to know both the contrib module and the custom one. What was the reason to not use the contrib module?

Hm, does it make even more sense to build a forum with site building tools? Basically a vocabulary for different Forums, a custom content type for Topics, comments for Replies, and Views to display various lists?
@Olaf Grabienski That sounds reasonable. I think that is how D8 does it (or similar anyway).

That sounds reasonable

Yep, at least at first sight! Wondering if there are any drawbacks, or pitfalls.

Olaf Grabienski said:

What was the reason to not use the contrib module?

In a word: @jenlampton

See https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/18#issuecomment-70576237

Excuse my ignorance but not sure I follow. I can do Friday 10 or 11am EST. How do I "claim" this slot?

Hm, does it make even more sense to build a forum with site building tools? Basically a vocabulary for different Forums, a custom content type for Topics, comments for Replies, and Views to display various lists?

@Olaf Grabienski This is exactly what we did with the forum site. The forum module was in core before core had views. With taxonomy, node types and views, my argument was that we didn't need a module to make a forum anymore, and instead, we should make sure that core could do everything in forum module.

Maybe we should release our version as an alternative solution...

@klonos @BWPanda The custom borg_forum module on b.org is not a replacement for the old forum module (since, we don't need a forum module anymore) instead, it's "a collection of all the misc stuff on the forum site". Most of my sites have one of these. If the site were named GobbledyGook, the module would have been mamed "borg_gobbledygook". Sorry for the confusion!

The custom borg_forum module on b.org is not a replacement for the old forum module

That's good news, thanks for the clarification!

@jenlampton I understand that's just a custom module of miscellaneous functionality/fixes, but my point still stands. Maybe we should create a contrib module that creates the content type, view, terms, etc. needed to setup a forum...
@BWPanda or a recipe?
If they ever get off the ground...

My point was that the "custom module of miscellaneous functionality/fixes" is unrelated to the site being a forum. But! We could export all the config that does make the site a forum and post that somewhere for people to use. Even if it's not an official "recipe" it could still be valuable.
Yes, that's what I was saying too :smile:
Actually Forum Module version 2.0 does exactly that. I sort of abandoned it 5 yrs ago but it seems to work just fine, providing a Views based Forum.
:thinking: ...is an upgrade path from the 7.x core module all that remains to be done then?
No I think just an indication that anyone wanted a Views based Forum. But 5 yrs later...
